answers.text:
Hello Toni,
I found some examples you may find helpful.
Almost all of the municipalities I researched require a combination of a mailing to residents, a newspaper advertisement, and a sign posted on the property in question announcing the hearing details. There were a few jurisdictions I found that seek to engage citizens in land use issues beyond minimum requirements.
Jefferson County, CO created a Citizens’ Guide to notifications in order to educate citizens on how they can expect to be notified:
http://coniferareacouncil.org/citizenotification.pdf
In Tampa, FL, neighborhood organizations may sign up to be notified regarding proposed land development:
http://www.tampagov.net/Zoning_Notice_WebApp/SelectNeighborhood.aspx
Douglas County, CO and Ventura County, CA offer citizens the option of signing up for email notifications regarding land use as well as a variety of other communications.
http://www.douglas.co.us/Email_Alerts_-_Notify_Me.html
http://vcrma.org/phplist/?p=subscribe&id=1
Pamela Weir
Management Intern 
Alliance for Innovation

author: Toni Shope
text:
A Virginia locality is looking for effective methods to notify and engage citizens on land use issues.  
Please share:
•   How you notify citizens of upcoming land use hearings ( the public hearing process for land use action)
•   Are citizens satisfied with the notification process?
•   Does your jurisdiction provide any notification that is over and beyond what is required by Va Code 15.2-2204?
Thank you for your assistance.
title: Engaging Citizens in VA Land Use Issues
